intro: Phyllanthus chekiangensis, commonly known as the Chinese phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and along streambanks. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
